admin.assistprovisionning.title: Include Node(s)
admin.assistprovisionning.subtitle: Will put ZiGate on pairing mode if needed, and then will report the result of provisionning. Press Go and start putting your device in pairing mode
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.title: Waiting for a node inclusion
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.subject: Node(s) provisionning
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.Failed: Failed (Something went wrong, check the log for more details)
admin.assistprovisionning.alert.inDB: Successful (check if widgets have been created)
admin.scan.group.device.title: Scan a selected list of Devices for groups memebership
admin.scan.group.device.subtitle: Will launche a scan for to each selected devices for their grups membership. You can select from one to many, and the result will populate the groups
admin.rescan.group.title: Rescan all devices for Group Memberships
admin.rescan.group.subtitle: Will launch a scan of all devices for their membership to groups. It will then populate the groups
admin.reloadplugin.title: Restart plugin
admin.reloadplugin.subtitle: Will restart the plugin
admin.permittojoin.label: Accept new hardware
admin.permittojoin.subtitle: Enable/Disable the pairing process with ZiGate for a period of time
admin.permittojoin.title: Accept new Hardware
admin.permittojoinrouter.subtitle: Enable/Disable the pairing process with ZiGate for a period of time
admin.permittojoinrouter.title: Accept new Hardware on router
admin.swreset.title: ZiGate Soft reset
admin.swreset.subtitle: Will restart ZiGate (no loss of paired devices)
admin.erasepdm.title: Erase ZiGate
admin.erasepdm.subtitle: Will erase the permanent data memory of ZiGate (You will lose all paired devices) You must enable the eraseZigatePDM parameter in Advanced Setting before
admin.erasepdm.alert.title: Erase ZiGate, Are you sure ?
admin.erasepdm.alert.subject: ATTENTION, last chance !!!!!
admin.reloadplugin.alert.title: Restart plugin, Are you sure ?
admin.reloadplugin.alert.subject: ATTENTION, last chance !!!!!
dashboard.plugin.update.available: There is an update available for the plugin. Stop the plugin and do a git pull in order to update it.
dashboard.plugin.update.available.title: Plugin update
dashboard.firmware.update.available.titl: A new firmware is available for the ZiGate. Available on https://github.com/fairecasoimeme/ZiGate/releases
dashboard.plugin.subtitle: Provides plugin informations
dashboard.stats.subtitle: Provides ZiGate statistics in terms of message transmission and reception
dashboard.zigate.subtitle: Provides ZiGate informations
dashboard.health.title: Health of plugin
dashboard.trafic.title: Traffic status ( Sent and Receive, Types and  Load)
dashboard.trafic.total.trafic.sent.label: Sent
dashboard.trafic.maxload.label: Load
dashboard.devices.title: Device status (Type, Health and Battery level)
dashboard.devices.label: Devices
dashboard.devices.state.label: Health
dashboard.devices.battery.label: Battery
dashboard.sent.comment: Total number of commands sent. ReTx is the number of Re-Transmissions done. This should be 0, but if the plugin is trying to send a command to a powered off device, you can get ReTx
dashboard.received.comment: Total number of messages received. Cluster is a type of message with information. CRC error should be 0. Otherwise it indicates communication errors
dashboard.trend.comment:
Last 10 minutes actitivies by every 5s.
Messages sent and received, ZiGate load queue
dashboard.devices.comment: Total of devices managed by the plugin. Router is main powered device which participates in the mesh network. End device is a battery based device
dashboard.health.comment: Live: indicates the number of devices alive, Lost: indicates the number of devices away from the network, No news: indicates the number of devices which haven't reported on the last 6 hours, Unknown: indicates the number of devices with status unknown. After a plugin restart, all devices are moved to status unknown until a message is received by ZiGate.
dashboard.battery.comment: For devices equiped with a battery, here after is reported the battery status.
device.byname.subtitle: List all HW devices paired with the plugin, and allow you to enter a friendly name for each device. It shows the friendly device name in the network section instead of a four digit code.
device.byname.header: List of devices managed by ZiGate
group.create.subtitle: Allow edit, create and remove groups. To apply changes, a restart in the admin section of the web interface is required.
group.reloadplugin.alert.title: Plugin Reload
group.reloadplugin.alert.subject: Groups have been updated, plugin need to be restarted
header.popover.title: Restart needed
header.popover.text: Some changes are pending a plugin restart is needed
network.stats.subtitle: Energy level reports
network.topo.subtitle: List of Network Topology. Select one to get the Mesh diagram
network.topo.visu.subtitle: The Topology diagram shows all links between 2 nodes. If you leave the cursor on a link you'll see the link direction as well as the link quality
network.topo.visu.network.subtitle: Will draw a network graph of your Zigbee environment.
network.topo.device.visu.subtitle: Provides the list of devices managed by ZiGate. You'll get also a reference to the Widget names and some other information from Domoticz
network.topo.device.visu.chart.title: Mesh Diagram
network.topology.req.subtitle: This will trigger a Topology scan, which will run in the background
network.inter.req.subtitle: An Energy scan report will be provided. It will report energy level between routers and ZiGate. In other terms how much power is received by the ZiGate. The higher the value, the better.
network.full.req.subtitle: As for the short energy scan, the report will provide energy level between all routers and ZiGate, handling all cross-communications. This report might take a while when the number of routers is high, n((n-1)/2), for 5 routers it is 10 combinations, for 10 routers 45
network.stats.detail.visu.chart.title: Energy level
setting.subtitle: Allow you to visualize and edit the various plugin settings. Some require a restart of the plugin.
setting.help.link: More information on the settings can be found on the Wiki
setting.help.legend: These are all plugin settings which can be updated.
setting.subtitle.Services: Enable the services you want to be active
setting.reloadplugin.alert.title: Plugin Reload
setting.reloadplugin.alert.subject: Settings have been updated, plugin need to be restarted
tools.debugcommand.title: Direct commands
tools.debugcommand.subtitle:
Allow to interact directly with a device, with a set of commands based on the device capabilities.
(1) Select the device,
(2) Select the action you want to perform,
(3) Select a potential device type which can influence the way to interact with the device,
(4) Optionaly you might have to enter a Value or select a Color.
tools.binding.title: Device Binds
tools.binding.subtitle: Allow to bind a cluster between source and target devices. e.g. If you want to bind a Temperature sensor with an Actuator, the SourceIEEE/Ep will be the Temperature sensor, the DestIEEE/Ep will be the actuator and the Cluster will be 0402 (Temperature Measurement)
tools.rawcommand.title: ZiGate command (raw)
tools.rawcommand.subtitle: Allow to send a ZiGate command directly to zigate in raw mode. you must follow the ZiGate protocol accordingly.( http://shorturl.at/hvBHJ )
setting.subtitle.DomoticzEnvironment: Setting on how to access Domoticz API
resetMotiondelay: Delay in sec to reset motion detection
setting.subtitle.DeviceManagement: Here are all settings related to Devices and how ZiGate interact with them
setting.subtitle.ZigateConfiguration: Here are all settings related to the ZiGate hardware.
setting.subtitle.OverTheAirUpgrade: These are all settings related to the Over The Air upgrade functionnality.
waitingOTA: delay when starting the OTA process
setting.subtitle.GroupManagement: Here are all setting to enable and configure the Group management feature.
setting.subtitle.Legrand: Allow to set a number of Legrand specifics options
setting.subtitle.Schneider Wiser: Allow to enable some specific mecanishm, and some other options
setting.subtitle.PluginConfiguration: Here are all Plugin environements settings
alarmDuration: Duration in sec for Alarm device
PowerOn_OnOff: Return state after device power outage
setting.subtitle.DevicePolling: Allow you to specify the polling frequency per type of information. Be aware that a high frequency will overload the ZiGate and might cause some performance issues
logLQI: Delay before starting a Topology scan (sec)
setting.subtitle.VerboseLogging: Will allow you to enable/disable some Logging features.
capturePairingInfos: Capture Pairing infos and save in Reports folder
setting.subtitle.Experimental: Use it only if you have been asked to
device.byname.alert.title: Delete device ?
device.byname.alert.subject: Are u sure ?
api.global.error.title: Error from backend
api.global.succes.update.title: Update sucessful
api.global.reset.zigate.title: Soft reset launched
api.global.succes.erasepdm.title: ErasePdm launched
api.global.succes.pluginrestarted.title: Plugin restarted
resetPermit2Join: Reset permit to join at startup
